name: Crew Quarters
description: Your personal cabin
The hum of life support fills the air. Dim lights flicker on automatically. The bunk is unmade. Personal effects are scattered â€” reminders of a life spent in the black.
A %personal locker% with twin sliding doors is built into the far wall. A hatch leads to *main corridor CH-1*.

name: Galley
description: A cramped kitchen area. Food synthesizer, water recycler, small table bolted to the floor.
Everything is functional, nothing is luxurious.
A hatch leads back to the *recreation room*.

name: Recreation Room
description: The ship's central hub for relaxation and social interaction.
Soft lighting and warm colors create a welcoming atmosphere.
The *main corridor CH-1* leads back towards your quarters.
Forward access to the *cockpit* is via a solid door.
The *galley* entrance is on the right side wall, while a
small *storage room* and *med-bay* access are opposite.

name: Cockpit
description: The command center of the ship.
Pilot's console, navigation charts, and sensor displays dominate the space.
The viewscreen shows the vastness of space ahead.
A solid door leads back to the *recreation room*.

name: Storage Room
description: The ships designated small storage room, a %large storage unit% is attached to the wall, and a %small cabinet% is mounted next to it.
The lighting here is harsh and functional. An automated storage facility is built into rear wall
A hatch leads back to the *recreation room*.

name: Hyper-sleep Chamber
description: A cramped room with dual stasis pods and various life support equipment.
A vital system to survive the month long journeys between worlds.
An archway leads back to the *med-bay*.

name: Med-Bay
description: A small medical facility with diagnostic equipment and first aid supplies.
The auto-doc hums quietly in the corner.
Sterile surfaces reflect the overhead lights.
A hatch leads back to the *recreation room*.
On the left is an archway leading to the *stasis chamber*.

name: Main Corridor CH-1
description: This passageway connects the main sections of the ship.
Overhead lights cast a steady glow on the metal deck plates.
The *recreation room* entrance leads forward towards the bridge.
Opposite your *crew quarters* is *sub corridor CH-2* to cargo hold.
While the *engineering* section is aft.

name: Sub Corridor CH-2
description: A secondary corridor that branches off *main corridor CH-1*.
Less trafficked, with fewer lights and occasional flickering panels.
At the end a large door leads to the *cargo bay*

name: Engineering
description: The ship's engineering bay, filled with tools and diagnostic equipment.
The reactor core thrums with contained energy.
A %large parts storage unit% sits next to a workbench,
opposite to this is a worn %tool storage cabinet%
A solid door leads back towards *main corridor CH-1*,
on the left wall a small hatch is labelled *life support*

name: Life Support
description: The life support systems room, with air recyclers and water purifiers.
Gauges show oxygen levels and humidity controls.
The air is fresh and slightly humid.
A small hatch leads back to *engineering*.

name: Airlock
description: The ship's airlock for spacewalks and docking.
EVA suits are racked along one wall.
The outer door seals tightly against the vacuum.
An inner hatch leads back to the *cargo bay*.

name: Cargo Bay
description: The main cargo storage area, stacked with containers and crates.
Loading ramps and cargo handlers stand idle.
The bay is spacious but dimly lit to save power.
On the left wall next to the *airlock* door is an %EVA equipment locker%.
On the opposite wall you see a %large cabinet%
A large door leads back to *sub corridor CH-2*,
At the opposite end of the bay is a hydraulically operated *external door*
